fields.name: Black Exodus
fields.description: Drew, the man behind 18th Street Brewery decided to launch his brewery when, following a visit to Belgium, he found he was unable to find similar beers back home in the States. Black exodus is a product of his imagination. Pouring a stygian black, powerful and condensed, Black Exodus is capped by a supremely creamy mocha-coloured head. The aroma evokes oatmeal, dark malt, chocolate, and caramelised brown sugar. On the tongue, you’ll find a light, pleasing bitterness with more coffee hints to give a dry acidity. The overall effect is smooth and highly accomplished.

fields.name: Citra Ass Down
fields.description: This beer is not candy or mother’s milk. It is not brewed by gypsies or aliens, nor does it contain any zombie dirt. This is a double IPA brewed with Citra Hops. It’s sticky, hoppy and delicious. Simply drink it and enjoy it. Don’t hoard this beer, Citra Ass Down and drink it now.

fields.name: Rico Sauvin
fields.description: Sexy beer for the sexy man. Brewed with Nelson Sauvin hops as sexy as Rico himself, this Double India Pale Ale has a strong, fruity flavor resembling that of fresh crush Sauvignon Blanc grapes, gooseberries, and passion fruit. Let it be known that Rico is out, for one thing, to be inside you!

fields.name: Hazy Jane
fields.description: New England detuned. This full-tilt fruit machine of an IPA packs all the flavour but less of the alcohol. Notes of pineapple,mango, stone-fruit, and a hint of tangerine to mix it up. Brewed with oats and wheat and left unfiltered for a smooth juicy hit.

fields.name: Clockwork Tangerine
fields.description: This fully automated IPA is infused with tangerine. At 4.5% it’s a stand-out session beer that packs a perfectly timed delivery of juicy citrus and mellow tropical fruit resting on a light toasty and caramel base. Fresh, juicy and sessionable.

fields.name: Love & Hate
fields.description: Traditionalists love beer that’s crystal clear, with restrained hops, and a delicate flavour.  They’re going to hate this… Love & Hate is our juicily crushable, unapologetically murky, New-England pale ale. An authentic Vermont yeast strain and a big dose of oats work together with our triple dry-hopping process to create beautiful aromas and a silky mouthful.

fields.name: Sweet Temptation
fields.description: Vocation's third collaboration beer with the giants of Brew York. With sweet notes of chocolate and caramel, this silky smooth, rich and seductive stout is impossible to resist.

fields.name: Raging Bitch
fields.description: One of the most talked about beers in years, Flying Dog's 20th Anniversary beer jumps out of the glass and nips at your taste buds! An American IPA augmented with Belgian yeast, Raging Bitch is dangerously drinkable and has a delicate hop bitterness.

fields.name: Thunderpeel
fields.description: Unfiltered for your pleasure, with haze for daze, Thunderpeel is Flying Dog's intensely-aromatic take on the New England IPA. The brew is dry-hopped with Citra, Galaxy, and Mosaic hops during fermentation to deliver a stormcloud of juiciness that’s 100% thunder and 100% peel.

fields.name: Chimay Blue Cap
fields.description: A dark, strong ale characterised by its full flavour and port-like aroma. Relatively dry with distinct caramel notes.

fields.name: Chimay Red Cap
fields.description: Chimay Red Cap is a dark brown colour with a sweet, fruity aroma and nutty character. It imparts a silky sensation to the tongue, made refreshing by a light touch of bitterness.

fields.name: Chimay White Cap
fields.description: Chimay White Cap was the 'last-born' of the Notre-Dame de Scourmont Abbey. Golden in colour, the beer combines a sweet and bitter balance. The fresh hop and yeasty aroma comes with fruity touches of Muscat grapes and raisins, even ripe apples. This traditional Belgian beer is best savoured fresh and at a temperature of from 6 to 8°C, ideally in the distinctive Chimay chalice glass.

fields.name: Chimay Gold Cap
fields.description: When it comes to ABV, one will notice that it is not high an ABV of 4.8°. Capacity of production is limited at 1000 hectoliters per year. The Chimay Gold is even lighter in ABV than a basic Pils, but with all the assets featured by a Trappist.

fields.name: Menabrea 1846
fields.description: A light coloured pilsner-style lager with a full flavour which belies its delicate appearance and yet remains well balanced with plenty of citrus zest, floral and subtle hop flavours. If you're searching for the authentic Italian lager look no further than Menabrea and discover the beer of choice for Italys top hotels, restaurants and bars.

fields.name: Flensburger Pilsener
fields.description: Flensburger Pilsener is unusually fresh with a full-bodied taste. A crisp, dry, hoppy pilsener style of beer typical of northern Germany. Light and easy to drink.

fields.name: Flensburger Dunkel
fields.description: A bottom-fermented, dark-amber-colored full beer with a pronounced roasted malt note, a complex body and a fine bitter character. Unique thanks to the balanced, characteristic caramel note, which spans its aroma curve over a spectrum from light toffee to mildly roasted coffee nuances.

fields.name: Moosehead
fields.description: Moosehead Breweries flagship brand is a golden lager that is light in body and highly refreshing, offering a fine balance between malt sweetness and hop bitterness. Made from an age-old yeast culture, Moosehead Lager is brewed longer to impart its unique flavour.  on the palate there are flavours of malt citrus fruit, yeast and spices

fields.name: Quilmes
fields.description: With nearly half the market share in it's home country, Quilmes can confidently claim to be 'Argentina’s Favourite Beer'. A pale golden colour, light hops and always refreshing.

fields.name: Altbairisch Dunkel
fields.description: Produced using the traditional double fermentation process, a Dunkel which Michael jackson, the Beer Hunter, described as 'impenetrably dark with a golden-brown gleam; with a warm aroma and malty taste, while summoning up coffee taste sensations on going down.

fields.name: Ayinger Celebrator
fields.description: This beer's origins in a monk's recipe are reflected in its heartiness. Almost black with a very slight red tone, the first taste is of mild fullness with an accompanying coffee tone, which becomes more dominant with the aftertaste. Little of the typical doppelbock sweetness.

fields.name: Sam Smith Pure Brewed Organic Lager
fields.description: Brewed with great care using only organic malted barley, organic hops, medium-soft water and a bottom-fermenting yeast; matured at low temperatures to bring out its delicate flavour and soft hop-character finish. The cold maturation period allows the bottom-fermenting yeasts to secondary ferment and improve this lager’s flavour, purity and condition.

fields.name: Sam Smith Organic Chocolate Stout
fields.description: Brewed with well water (the original well, sunk in 1758, is still in use with the hard water is drawn from 85 feet underground), the gently roasted organic chocolate malt and organic cocoa impart a delicious, smooth and creamy character, with inviting deep flavours and a delightful finish – this is the perfect marriage of satisfying stout and luxurious chocolate.

fields.name: Broken Dream
fields.description: An indulgence of chocolate and speciality malts, Broken Dream is smooth, unctuous and moreish. It's brewed with milk sugar for balance and mouthfeel, along with carefully selected espresso from London's Climpson & Sons. Awarded CAMRA Supreme Champion Beer of Britain 2018.

fields.name: Keller Pils
fields.description: Sometimes the simple things in life are the best. We take Pilsner malt from Germany and combine with three traditional hop varieties – Magnum, Perle and Hallertauer Mittelfruh – to produce a clean, unfiltered, Hop Bitter Lager Beer.

fields.name: Jaipur
fields.description: The immediate impression of this wonderful multi award-winning India Pale Ale is soft and smooth but this builds around the mouth to a crescendo of massive hoppiness accentuated by honey.

fields.name: AM:PM
fields.description: AM:PM a truly sessionable beer that allows you to enjoy all the flavours and body of an IPA. Bags of tropical fruit aromas, pineapple, tangerine, guava and passion fruit are balanced with a chewy, honeyed malt character.

fields.name: Railway Porter
fields.description: The Five Points Railway Porter is a rich take on the traditional London Porter. Brewed with East Kent Goldings, the Railway Porter is laden with aromas and flavours of roasted coffee, bitter chocolate and dark toffee.
